intro: Bixa atlantica, commonly known as the "barbados nut" or "kohlrabi," is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a capsule fruit that contains several seeds surrounded by a reddish-orange aril, which is the source of the dye and oil. Bixa atlantica is cultivated for its seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a natural coloring agent. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and cultural contexts.
